text: I am trying to use Operations Hub - Workflow custom code. The code is working when I test it individually, and it has output as Boolean value. I want to use output data late in the next workflow in “Value Equals Branch” but my workflow always goes to “Not Meet” branch despite the data output whether is true or false, any thought?
Hi, did anyone face issues configuring webhooks with custom properties?
Can you give give a screenshot of the output?
Also, don't forget about your output variables

Hi everyone,

is there a way to retrieve blog posts based on two tags with api call ? like if user select tags from filter dropdown 1 and 2 and then it will fetch those posts that have those specific two tags .
Don't think this is possible
Maybe <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/cms/page>?
Check under endpoints & then Get all Site Pages
<@U02412A8Q3V> above link is not working. FYI, i am interested in fetching blog posts based on two tag filters at once.
Oh sorry it's <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/cms/pages>
Doesn't seem to be a filter for a specific field

I found this on the forums, basically to create an email using api. It should enable me to populate the email body module with an html block.
```Request URL:
POST <https://api.hubapi.com/marketing-emails/v1/emails?hapikey={{hapikey}}>

{
		"name": "My first API marketing email!",
		"subject": "Sample subject line",
		"fromName": "Sample Author",
		"campaign": "eeeeeeee-eeee-eeee-eeee",
		"CampaignName": "Sample - My first inbound campaign in HubSpot",
		"emailBody": "Email Body"
	}```
Thanks for sharing link again but this is not what i am looking for blog filters.
<@U02412A8Q3V> yes sure, these are screenshots as requested:
Can you do a console lof of isLess50 before the callback?
You get "false" as a return, but checking on "yes" & "no"
Because, when I use the isLess50 in branch action, I only have two value available "Yes" or "No", so there is not "false" or "true" value in "value equal branch" ?
can you try it with an if else branch? Instead of the simple branch
Custom code output is not available in "if/else branch"? I can only see custom code data output in "value equal branch" or "copy property value".

Hi everyone

I have to transfer some data from a Piplene to a module to mount it on a website, the idea is that each business that is closed is added somewhere on the site and that it is seen, but in real time. Do you know something like that?
I'm working in postman doing some custom object stuff, what are the available object types that this kind of request is looking for `{{baseUrl}}/crm/v3/objects/:objectType/:objectId`
where can I find the available `objectType` values? The one I specifically need is a marketing event
ok, i think I got it: `objectType` is the general Id for the custom object (you can grab it from the url)
objectId would be an instance of that object
I think what confused me most is that sometimes it is called `objectType` and sometimes it is called `objectTypeId`—that really threw me off

He <@UDHT6N5SM> thanks for posting your problems and thoughts. I've been stuck playing catchup with local dev with themes but also working on APIs using AppScripts. Reading what you are working on always keeps me thinking about other things I want to work on in the future. I was trained on postman (lightly like a 6 week bootcamp) but haven't had the time to get back to it yet just wondering do you have any insights into the best way forward when I get ready to use it to explore HubSpot's APIs.
Hey, awesome, glad my ramblings are helpful.

I think the core gotchas to consider are:
• objectType and objectTypeId appear to be the same thing
• Some of the examples include `?portalId=1234567` in the request which as far as I can tell always throws a 404 error
• I'll include a screenshot of my basic auth setup—it's easy but wasn't obvious to me.  Using OAuth is probably the better approach beyond messing around.
• You can't exactly go by the default "examples" or that automatically get included when you add HubSpot CRM to Postman
Others might have better insights, I'm at the "just got things working" point after riding waves of confusion
auth setup, I think there's a way to inherit from the parent level but still messing around with that
oh, +1 insight, looking at the url of custom objects is helpful in identifying the various parameters that are used in requests
Great info thank you!!
